events.event_name: Moody's Sovereign Credit Rating Outlook Change
events.description: Moody's Investors Service changed Indonesia's sovereign credit rating outlook from stable to negative.
Official data release showing Indonesia's economic growth for 2025.
President Prabowo took office in October 2024.

facts.fact_text: The IDX Composite fell 130 points (1.5%) to 7,976 during Friday morning trade.

evidences.evidence_text: Indonesia’s IDX Composite tumbled 130 points, or 1.5%, to 7,976 in Friday morning trade

facts.fact_text: Moody's affirmed Indonesia's Baa2 rating despite the outlook change.

evidences.evidence_text: The agency, meanwhile, affirmed the Baa2 rating.

facts.fact_text: The Indonesian economy grew by 5.11% in 2025, missing the 5.2% target.

evidences.evidence_text: official data released showed the economy grew 5.11% in 2025, below the government’s 5.2% target

facts.fact_text: Specific stocks including Impact Pratama Industri and Merdeka Copper Gold saw significant declines.

evidences.evidence_text: Steep decliners included Impact Pratama Industri (-4.7%), Merdeka Copper Gold (-4.3%), Vale Indonesia (-3.6%), and Astra Intl. (-2.2%).

claims.claim_text: Moody's believes policy predictability has reduced and governance has weakened under President Prabowo.
claims.author: Moody's Investors Service

evidences.evidence_text: citing reduced policy predictability and weaker governance under President Prabowo, who took office in October 2024

claims.claim_text: Fiscal rhetoric from officials helped limit the market's downward movement.

evidences.evidence_text: Still, weakness was capped by fiscal rhetoric, with officials trying to push back against pessimistic deficit narratives

claims.claim_text: Officials suggest there is still available policy space to manage the economy.
claims.author: Indonesian Officials

evidence.evidence_text: Indonesia’s IDX Composite tumbled... after Moody’s Investors Service changed the country’s sovereign credit rating outlook
citing reduced policy predictability and weaker governance under President Prabowo
the economy grew 5.11% in 2025, below the government’s 5.2% target
weakness was capped by fiscal rhetoric, with officials trying to push back against pessimistic deficit narratives
